answers.author: Eric Johnson
answers.text:
Hillsborough County, Florida, has had a zero-base budgeting approach since the late 80's. It was originally designed by an analyst here who had worked for the State of Georgia during Jimmy Carter's introduction of the concept there as Governor. It wasn't my idea but I was here when it was implemented and used it for 15 years as the County's budget director.
It has tended to work well through good times and bad although there are always those who game any system.
Eric Johnson
Management Services Administrator
Hillsborough County. 
813.272.6582
johnsone@hillsboroughcounty.org

author: Kenneth Jacobs
text:
My capstone research paper is going to be about municipalities that use a zero-based budgeting system along with a comprehensive how-to guide for adopting the system.
I am looking for municipalities that have adopted a zero-based budgeting system, specifically:
- Individuals with an organization during the transition phase, and
- Individuals with an organization that uses ZBB, but was not there for the transition.
Thanks for any assistance.
I'd like to know if there has been a noticeable benefit in adopting ZBB as well.
From my initial research I wasn't able to find many municipalities using ZBB - if I get similar results here, I may do something else.
title: Is your city using a zero-based budgeting system?
